name: Red Crucible®: Firestorm
description: Destroy, smash and blast your way to victory! Use advanced weapons and vehicles to dominate the battlefield.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel® Core™ i3 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Intel® Integrated Graphics DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 4 GB available space Sound Card: Integrated Sound Card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8.1 Processor: Intel® Core™ i7 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX660 or equivalent DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 4 GB available space Sound Card: Integrated Sound Card

reviews.review_text: Alot of people have said this, but this game is a pay-to-win game. I have been playing since the beginning of Rc2 in 2013. The game was okay, obivously the game in that state of time wasn't the best. Overtime Rc2 became better, becoming the game I would spend most of my time playing. Then RCF came around and everything change. I'm assuming RGS were determine to make money of this version of the game. So they added War chests, Legendary chests, new weapons every week. In the past (Rc2), you normally got what you pay for. Like for instance, Gold weapons cost 1000 coins. That's about $30. With the introduction of War chests, I lost over $500 dollars, but I know what you're probaly thinking. It's risky but we're talking ten year olds kids steling money from their parents, just to get this some 'special' gun. I know, I've been there. I don't recommend anyone to this game because RGS don't care about the fans, they f___ing care about making easy money. Thank you if you spend 5 minutes of your day to view this.

Thanks to this beautiful G.O.T.Y,  I have now realized that nothing can come between me and my 0.7 hours of pure fun. My favorite part was that you got all the fun of playing a flash game while having do download it! You can have a GTX Titan X or a GeForce 210, this game will always run the same. Great sounds too, down to Earth with home recorded audio. My favorite part of the physical experience is the explosions, if you haven't seen them, I recommend you check those out.   Quoting 'Free As Free Can Be' : 'A registered trademark of the Red Crucible brand, Red Crucible: Firestorm brings the definitive Red Crucible shooting experience into your very own home'  Yes, into your very own home, just like every other ♥♥♥♥ing game you've ever bought; one of my very favorite curator reviews. This game is utter trash and should not be on the store. Easy download, easier uninstall.
Step 1:  Grab a Helicopter. Step 2: Crash it into enemies vehicles. Step 3: Repeat this process till everyone ragequits.  10/10 would Kamikaze again.
Why did you discontinue the game for Linux? It used to be a not bad game, but now i can't even play it.
Bring back red crucible 2, you didn't stop the spawn camping in firestorm and the community has shrunk from 10,000 players to like 200. Pay to win game.

I used to play this game frequently. I liked it. Fun FPS. I guess it's no longer offered on a Linux/Steam Play platform though. Cannot seem to get the game started anylonger. Forums don't suggest this is so, but I am unable to find anyone else with the same issue. So. Ballz.

I love this game, with its many playstyles, and while it has limited maps, it allows you to get a good feel of them and find all the nooks and crannies. 9.3/10. Only negative point is a the saiga12, and the lack of maps.

After nearly 300 hours of gameplay, i can say that the devs are here for your money. I am ashamed that i spent this much time with it, it was probably just me hoping to see if it will ever go back to the RC2 style format, but that is clearly not happening now(even if it did, i lost interest in it now, found better games my PC can handle). However i'd still recommend following their news just to see what kind of ♥♥♥♥ they'll add next.Also, the devs seem to love russia quite abit.
LOVE THIS GAME 10 OUT OF ♥♥♥♥ING 10

This game is so bad, let me explain why.   I understand that this is a free to play game, but theres a good reason its free to play. 1. Bad graphics: This looks like its played on a play station 2 or original xbox. 2. Bad controls: They seem weird and clunky. 3. God awful voice acting: I think I've only hear 2 voices the entire game: The very unitimidating drill sargeant, and the guy who says something like 'whe'll get em next time' when you lose a game. Your soldiers don't say anything, so it makes the battle boring. 4. Bad sound: The guns sound like ♥♥♥.  This could be a good game, but it's very underdeveloped.

Very good game and very addictive gameplay. Even if you lose most matches, don't give up. I myself have lost more than I even care to remember and even have to restart everything in the game when steam took the linux version off the launcher.(The linux version is currently available on Rocketeer's website.) My point is, keep on gaming and don't ever give up.

Tunnel Vision Simulator 2016.  Teammates are unreliable (in fact this game was also a browser game on Kongregate and Facebook), horrible and inconsistent weapon customization. Clunky handling, dated SFX and ultimately boils down to who peeks which corner using the third person camera.  This thing has its ♥♥♥ in so many places, I couldn't blame it. After all it is running at something like 50 FOV so it can't even see.
good game free battlefield

Who needs COD or Battlefield anymore? Red Crucible is the real deal people.   The graphics maxed out on 4k resolution is amazing. Ever seen a realistic portrayal of a body getting blown to bits? No? Play this game and be amazed. The little details like they actually put leaves on the trees! I wish this game had VR because it would like being in the battlefield itself.  The sound is ultra good also. Every gun makes noise! The voice acting is top notch too, who ever the actor was that voiced the line 'enemy down' should win an award.  Gameplay wise you cannot beat this game. The controls are super tight. You click a button and it responds! Amazing!  10/10 all day long

Its a fun game, but was much better when it was called red crucible 2 and you could get stuff relativly fast. Now you have to grind constanly. Its always had a certain degree of pay to win aspects, but now there are way too many. Also they make you spend Credits on maps? WTF?!? Is this the poor man's Ea? Truth be told it is fun, but just play red crucible 2 on kongregate instead...Its way more fun. Plus the graphics are the same.

Despite what the reviews say, I think you might as well download this game and give it a shot. The game only takes a few minutes to download and only takes about 1GB of space. The game is vey arcady, your not gonna get any quality 'MilSim' gameplay out of this. It is very p2w but I haven't encountered anyone yet who completely dominated the game since their items were so powerful. I haven't spent a cent on this game and still manage to get about a 2 kdr every round, so this game is not awfully unbalanced. I enjoy infantry combat over vehicular and play infantry only much more, so I can't make any remarks on the vehicles. I encourage anyone who actually read my review to at least give the game a try, and uninstall it if its not appealing to you.

How i missed Red Crucible 2, with it's old mechanics (no fall damage, infinite ammo) and fun, i played it almost every day, but then it became Red Crucible Firestorm, i din't mind, because Red Crucible 2 was still there, it was then when Rocketeer ♥♥♥♥ed up and deleted red crucible 2 all together, only transfering your items to firestorm.  This game did not innovate in any way from Red Crucible 2, in fact, it got worse.  These are the new bad things i learned from recently playing: Your armor is pure decoration now, it used to give you extra health, now a double tap in the foot with a pistol will bring you down as if it were a granade exploding in your mouth. Then there are the premium weapons, straight upgrades to everything with cool modifications, all of which cost the in-game premium currency (clever way of stealing your money without refunds) called Coins, it costs a ♥♥♥♥ ton of coins to buy one of these premium weapons and the coins themselves are everything but cheap.  This game is completely ♥♥♥♥ing ruined.

Summary: its a crappy free to play BROWSER game, that has the audacity to put in microtransactions.  Long Story:  Pros:   *the maps are big  *the microtransactions are at the least out of your way  *its freeeeeeeee   Cons:  *The maps are big, but that dosent make it better. There empty, boring, and a pain to traverse.   *There is a lack of maps and two of them are the same exact one except one has snow.  *the graphics are ♥♥♥♥ even for a free to play game.  *the combat itself is mindless, not even call of duty mindless where you atleast get some satisfaction from killing something. The guns make no noise, have no recoil, and when the bullets hit someone the character dosent flinch and when you do get shot at, you dont even realize it since you have no reaction. No jam on the screen,no slowing down, nothing.  *the community sucks.... period  *with the big maps the game has veichles, like... two... maybe three. And they suck too. no weight, slow or slippery, and the combat is exactly like the gunplay. mindless and unsatifying.  *GLITCHY AS BALLS, terrain disapering, geting stuck in objects.    Dont get this game. The only reason you should is to laugh at it. The lazziness of this game is hilariouslt bad. The glitches are funny and the graphics and the modeling of some objects i find funny.
You can get a lot out of this game, counting it's free it is very good, and I like it. Another similar game that is free and good is Fistfull of Frags.

If you play this game on your own, it appears to be a boring, pay to win shooter.  If you play this game with friends, it becomes a massive black hole with a rainbow tutu around it that sucks away all the bad things that have happened to you in your life and leaves only smiles and butterflies in your field of vision.  Yeah, you can run around and shoot each other... or you can play bumper cars!   You can try to take over a command point... or you can find the hidden UFO!   You can try to run over someone... or you can role play as the managment team of the only cinnamon bun shop open during a war!  You can punch something until it succumbs to your every whim and desire... or... or... you can do that, which sounds pretty freaking awesome, actually.  At the end of the day, it's a free food service sim/racing/puzzle/fighting game. If you think it's just a pay to win FPS, you're not trying hard enough.

THE ONLY Few PRO or GOOD POINT of this game is that it's free.  The game is currently low system requirement.  Has both gun and vehicle maps. Has many gun selections  (THERE's a bad side tro this though.....greedy devs' have REDICULOUS PRICES for their guns/vehicles: which some are released even though they are bugged or broken.)   Now that we got the good out of the way here is  Hackers heaven, devs do nothing about it or respond really late to it.  Bugged out game.....SO MANY Bugs it ain't even funny, you'd think they would have like a time-frame of trying to fix  them little by little. BUT NO! they instead just keep releasing more guns and vehicles to sell and leave ♥♥♥♥ as broken as it is.  No Team BALANCING.
